message_1: Given the message "HELLO WORLD" and a cryptographic hash function that produces a 256-bit hash value, what is the hash value of the message?
message_2:
As an AI language model, I cannot perform cryptographic hashing directly. However, I can guide you on how to compute the hash value of the message "HELLO WORLD" using a 256-bit hash function like SHA-256.

You can use a programming language or an online tool to compute the hash value. Here's an example using Python:

```python
import hashlib

message = "HELLO WORLD"
hash_object = hashlib.sha256(message.encode())
hash_value = hash_object.hexdigest()

print(hash_value)
```

If you run this code, you will get the SHA-256 hash value of the message "HELLO WORLD". Alternatively, you can use an online SHA-256 hash generator to obtain the hash value. Keep in mind that the hash value is case-sensitive, so "HELLO WORLD" and "hello world" will have different hash values.
